body_html: Hey @pjh5, you said "There should be a symlink from /usr/local/cuda to the CUDA version that you want to use." This isn't necessarily true; for example, setting CUDA_HOME to specify a different CUDA directory should be a supported operation, right?

body: Hey @pjh5, you said "There should be a symlink from /usr/local/cuda to the CUDA version that you want to use." This isn't necessarily true; for example, setting `CUDA_HOME` to specify a different CUDA directory should be a supported operation, right?
